content.description: Thin and technical start passing bolt 1.  Main crux pulling bulge after clipping bolt 3.
content.protection: 4 Bolts, 2 bolt anchor with chains and lowering biners. Can set a TR, but you need to down climb a bit to the anchors. There is a single bolt to protect this, but be cautious trusting one bolt. There are gear placement options to supplement the bolt.
content.location: Starts just left of the large detached block.

content.description: Delicate climbing on the lower slab to larger holds face climbing up the head wall.  The rating applies to the path of least resistance.
content.location: The route is the rightmost slab route.  Rap the route.

content.description: Pull onto the Rock and over the initial bulge. From here the steepness backs off but the holds also get smaller. Grade may vary depending on how much you wander from the bolt line.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains. Easy to set up TR from top.
content.location: To the right of the cave.

content.description: The bottom moves are the difficult portion of the climb.  Climb the upper right to left crack to a small ledge and easier climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  There are optional gear placements between the first and second bolt and above the third bolt below the anchor.  The climb finishes at a separate bolted anchor with chains.
content.location: This is the slanting crack just right of Imported Women.

content.description: Moderate climbing through 4 bolts. Anchors are located at top of black streak up and right of bolt 4. After clipping bolt 4 heading directly to the anchors is much more difficult than any previous moves. To stay at the 5.8 grade, either work right to the shallow dihedral, or left to the vertical crack at the top of European Sweetheart.  Then top out to reach the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  Bring slings to extend over the edge.

content.description: Begins with engaging slab climbing up the detached block with three bolts for protection. At top of block clip 4th bolt (extended with chain) and step across onto the steep face through one more bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Two-bolt anchor with chains. Easy access to set TR.
content.location: Up the center of the detached block a the base of the wall.

content.description: Easiest route at Wallflower. Goes up an initial ledge system to gated cold-shut anchors. Originally a TR line, this is now a sport climb for you bolt clipping pleasure.
content.protection: Four bolts to gated cold-shut anchors.

content.description: Slab start to one bolt, then follows a left trending crack/flake  to the top. Gear looks thin at best, especially if going directly to the anchors from the end of the flake. Can move left into the crack/shallow dihedral for better placement options.  Though listed as a trad line, this is most commonly set up as a TR.
content.protection: One bolt and some smaller pieces. Gated cold-shuts for top anchors.
content.location: Look for the lone bolt ~10feet off the ground leading to the left trending flake/crack.

content.description: Follow the diagonal right trending crack until it ends. Continue straight up to anchors at the top of the black shallow dihedral.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor set back slightly from the top. Bring some slings to extend over the lip.

content.description: Climb the arete of the right side of the detached block clipping two bolts. Make an awkward transition onto the face right of the block and clip the two more bolts on your way to the anchors. This can be a bit spicy for a leader at the grade, with a potentially bad fall moving between bolts two and three.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains. The location of the anchor is not easily accessed from the top.
content.location: starts on the right arete of the detached block.

climbs.name: Alt-Frack
climbs.fa: Mark Grazier, Deb Evans & Karl Kiser, winter 2017

content.description: Start left on the slab, climb the bottom of the crack, traverse right out of the crack (around the third bolt) and face climb to the top.
content.protection: Bolts to a clip through anchor.
content.location: This is the bolted variation of Imaginery Girlfriend.

content.description:
East facing cliff to the north of the Main Spook Wall. The area has a variety of routes in the 5.6-5.10 range that are mostly sport climbs with a few trad or toprope only lines. Virtually all climbs can easily be set as topropes by scrambling to the top of the cliff via 3rd class scramble to the climbers right side of the cliff. 

  Gets morning sun and evening shade and is protected from most winds except easterly. Summer evenings are surprisingly comfortable due to the shade. 

  Most of the routes were listed in the "black book" by Maestas and Jones, but no FA info is given. Please provide if you know any details.
